Introduction to metalite.ae

Source: vignettes/metalite-ae.Rmd
metalite-ae.Rmd

Overview

metalite.ae is an R package for standard adverse events analysis including:

  • AE summary
  • Specific AE analysis
  • Specific AE subgroup analysis (TODO)
  • AE listing (TODO)

Workflow

The general workflow is splitted into three parts.

  1. Define meta data information using metalite package
  2. Prepare outdata using prepare_xxx functions
  3. Extend outdata using extend_xxx functions
  4. Format outdata using format_xxx functions
  5. Create TLFs using tlf_xxx functions

For example, we can create a simple AE summary table as below.

meta_ae_dummy() |>
  prepare_ae_summary(
    population = "apat",
    observation = "wk12",
    parameter = "any;rel;ser"
  ) |>
  format_ae_summary() |>
  tlf_ae_summary(
    source = "Source:  [CDISCpilot: adam-adsl; adae]",
    path_outtable = "outtable/ae0summary.rtf"
  )
#> [1] "any"
#> [1] "rel"
#> [1] "ser"
#> The output is saved in/home/runner/work/metalite.ae/metalite.ae/vignettes/outtable/ae0summary.rtf

More examples can be found in vignette("ae-summary") and vignette("ae-specific").

Highlighted features

  • Enable metadata structure
  • Consistent input and output in standard functions
  • Streamline mock table generation
